clip_assessment.verbatim_quote: Anybody who sends me these postcards as consistently as you've done for the past 10 months, that's who I want to work with.
clip_assessment.guest_voice: Jay speaks in conversational, meandering storytellingâ€”authentic, self-deprecating, and brutally honest about his near-bankruptcy. He doesn't polish his struggles.
clip_assessment.why_this_stops_scrolls: It validates the hidden fear every agent hasâ€”that their marketing isn't workingâ€”and proves the exact moment consistency pays off.

HOOK.text: He mailed postcards for ten months. Got nothing. Zero calls. Almost went bankrupt.
HOOK.production_note: Text on screen: '10 MONTHS. $0 RESULTS.' Anxious, tense music.

SETUP.text: Jay Cannone's a top 1% producer now. But back then? He was on a conference call with other agents celebrating wins while he was sitting there broke. Ready to quit the whole marketing thing.
SETUP.production_note: B-roll: Empty desk, bills piled up. Cut to Jay's headshot with 'TOP 1% PRODUCER' credential.

INSIGHT.text: Month eleven. A luxury seller calls. Jay asks why him. The guy says: 'Anybody who sends me these postcards as consistently as you've done for the past ten monthsâ€”that's who I want to work with.' Not the best design. Not the cleverest copy. Consistency. The seller had been watching. Testing. Waiting to see if Jay would quit like everyone else.
INSIGHT.production_note: Overlay: Phone ringing. Cut to Jay's actual quote as audio. Text on screen: 'MONTH 11.' Then: 'CONSISTENCY = CREDIBILITY.'

REFRAME.text: You think nobody's noticing your marketing. They are. They're just not ready yet. Every postcard, every email, every videoâ€”it's a deposit. And the people worth working with? They're counting.
REFRAME.production_note: Slow-motion B-roll: Mail being delivered, emails landing in inbox. Calm, hopeful music shift.

CTA.text: So here's the question: What marketing did you quit on at month nine? Full episode link in bioâ€”Jay breaks down the exact system that saved his career.
CTA.production_note: Text on screen: 'WHAT DID YOU QUIT ON?' Freeze on Jay's face. End card: 'FULL EPISODE ðŸ”—'

caption: He almost quit at month 10. Month 11 changed everything. The full story will gut you.
